verses.kjv: Now those that sealed were, Nehemiah, the Tirshatha, the son of Hachaliah, and Zidkijah,
verses.ct: The following people signed the sealed document: Nehemiah the governor, son of Hachaliah, and Zidkijah,

verses.kjv: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah: these were the priests.
verses.ct: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah — these were the priests.

verses.kjv: And the Levites: both Jeshua the son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel;
verses.ct: The Levites included: Jeshua son of Azaniah, Binnui from the descendants of Henadad, Kadmiel,

verses.kjv: And their brethren, Shebaniah, Hodijah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,
verses.ct: and their brothers: Shebaniah, Hodijah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,

verses.kjv: The chief of the people; Parosh, Pahathmoab, Elam, Zatthu, Bani,
verses.ct: The leaders of the people included: Parosh, Pahathmoab, Elam, Zatthu, Bani,

verses.kjv: And the rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the porters, the singers, the Nethinims, and all they that had separated themselves from the people of the lands unto the law of God, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, every one having knowledge, and having understanding;
verses.ct: The remaining people — priests, Levites, gatekeepers, singers, temple servants, and everyone who had set themselves apart from the surrounding nations to follow God's law, along with their wives, sons, and daughters, everyone old enough to understand —

verses.kjv: They clave to their brethren, their nobles, and entered into a curse, and into an oath, to walk in God’s law, which was given by Moses the servant of God, and to observe and do all the commandments of the LORD our Lord, and his judgments and his statutes;
verses.ct: joined together with their leaders and bound themselves with a solemn oath and a curse upon themselves if they failed, committing to live by God's law that was given through Moses the servant of God, and to carefully follow all the commands, regulations, and statutes of the LORD our Lord.

verses.kjv: And that we would not give our daughters unto the people of the land, nor take their daughters for our sons:
verses.ct: "We will not give our daughters in marriage to the surrounding peoples, and we will not let our sons marry their daughters.

verses.kjv: And if the people of the land bring ware or any victuals on the sabbath day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath, or on the holy day: and that we would leave the seventh year, and the exaction of every debt.
verses.ct: If the surrounding peoples bring merchandise or food to sell on the Sabbath day, we will refuse to buy from them on the Sabbath or on any holy day. We will also let the land rest every 7th year and cancel all debts."

verses.kjv: Also we made ordinances for us, to charge ourselves yearly with the third part of a shekel for the service of the house of our God;
verses.ct: We also established rules requiring ourselves to contribute a 3rd of a shekel each year for the service of the house of our God —

verses.kjv: For the shewbread, and for the continual meat offering, and for the continual burnt offering, of the sabbaths, of the new moons, for the set feasts, and for the holy things, and for the sin offerings to make an atonement for Israel, and for all the work of the house of our God.
verses.ct: for the bread displayed before God, for the regular grain offering, for the regular burnt offering, for the Sabbath offerings, the new moon offerings, the appointed festivals, the sacred offerings, the sin offerings to make atonement for Israel, and for all the other work of the house of our God.

verses.kjv: And we cast the lots among the priests, the Levites, and the people, for the wood offering, to bring it into the house of our God, after the houses of our fathers, at times appointed year by year, to burn upon the altar of the LORD our God, as it is written in the law:
verses.ct: We — the priests, Levites, and people — drew lots to determine which families would bring wood to the house of our God at designated times throughout the year, to be burned on the altar of the LORD our God, just as the law requires.

verses.kjv: And to bring the firstfruits of our ground, and the firstfruits of all fruit of all trees, year by year, unto the house of the LORD:
verses.ct: We also committed to bring the first produce from our land and the first fruit from every tree each year to the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Also the firstborn of our sons, and of our cattle, as it is written in the law, and the firstlings of our herds and of our flocks, to bring to the house of our God, unto the priests that minister in the house of our God:
verses.ct: Additionally, as the law requires, we would bring our firstborn sons and the firstborn of our cattle, herds, and flocks to the house of our God, to the priests who serve there.

verses.kjv: And that we should bring the firstfruits of our dough, and our offerings, and the fruit of all manner of trees, of wine and of oil, unto the priests, to the chambers of the house of our God; and the tithes of our ground unto the Levites, that the same Levites might have the tithes in all the cities of our tillage.
verses.ct: We would also bring the first portion of our ground meal, our contributions, the fruit of every kind of tree, new wine, and olive oil to the priests in the storerooms of the house of our God. We would give a 10th of our crops to the Levites, since the Levites collect the tithes in all the towns where we farm.

verses.kjv: And the priest the son of Aaron shall be with the Levites, when the Levites take tithes: and the Levites shall bring up the tithe of the tithes unto the house of our God, to the chambers, into the treasure house.
verses.ct: A priest descended from Aaron must accompany the Levites when they collect the tithes, and the Levites must bring a 10th of the tithes up to the house of our God, into the storerooms of the treasury.

verses.kjv: For the children of Israel and the children of Levi shall bring the offering of the corn, of the new wine, and the oil, unto the chambers, where are the vessels of the sanctuary, and the priests that minister, and the porters, and the singers: and we will not forsake the house of our God.
verses.ct: The people of Israel and the descendants of Levi must bring their contributions of grain, new wine, and olive oil to the storerooms where the sacred vessels are kept and where the serving priests, gatekeepers, and singers work. We will not neglect the house of our God.
